intro: Borojoa venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan borojo, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
